This is a great game.  I have it on xbox and saw the comparisons to the PC.  The PC version easily has better graphics and control so I bought it.  So far I have only played it for an hour but it still is as good as ever.  Now the graphics are way better.  It is the type of game you would play if you like Oblivion.\nAlso the story is great.  There is so much to it.  There is a mystery that needs to be solved.  Where do the treasures come from?  Where did all the antagonists come from?  It feels like a living breathing world you have just stumbled upon.  Recommended.

This game starts out hard. The unforgiving, really freaking hardness that makes you quit, cheat, or reload save games a LOT (death is permanent there FPS junkies!). For graphics, the human models are definitely dated but the flora, fauna and non-human entities are still quite good today (2014). The scenery might not be Witcher 2 quality, but it comes decently close. The night and day cycle with changing weather also makes running around the island an enjoyable experiance (bring a torch, it's scary out there in the dark!).

That said, this game drew me right in after I got past the constant whooping that I received by boars (yeah, pigs kicked my tush and I couldn't do anything about it for a while). I believe it was the muscial score that really slapped me in the face and made me stick it out.

There are two factions - the outlaws in the swamp and the mages in the town. Interestingly enough, your choice of which faction to join *can* heavily influence your weapon choices and whether or not you use offensive magic. Scrolls, which don't use up mana, can be used even by full on melee characters and are a requirement later in the game.

If you are caught stealing, the people near you attack! They won't like you much afterward, but you can cast a Joke scroll on them to make them laugh which makes them tolerate you again. Now that is an interesting mechanic, as I had knocked out several NPCs after being caught stealing only to be able to do business with them later with a Joke scroll.

Melee and bow/crossbow combat is simple but elegant, with the only downside being able to effectively attack AND block. Some enemies can score 3 hits in quick succesion on you if you try to attack at the wrong time. Zooming in (manual aim) with a crossbow resets your FOV distance for your character, which is a bit annoying but not game breaking.

The storytelling is pretty darned good in this game - I was drawn in and actually cared not just for my character, but for several other NPCs throughout my questing.

You may be on a fairly small island, but there is a LOT to do and even more nooks and crannies to explore. All the while the musical score wowed me - yes it repeats, but it really clinches the deal and makes this an amazing game. I honestly didn't mind stopping to pick the plants that are everywere all while I listened to the haunting (almost goosebump giving) music.

I am very, very happy to have come across this game years after its release. To be drawn in by the beautiful tropical island landscape, to lose myself in the music and story, and to jump right out of my skin when a skeleton bursts out of a just raided tomb makes this an almost perfect game - 95/100.

If you appreciate a little more structure than the Elder Scrolls series with a smaller world, you will love this game. Well, provided the boars don't make you quit ;-D

Quite an interesting game with a vast openworld to explore, but...it glitchy as hell. The quests don't complete properly among other things. But it's fun to just troll around Harbor Town and other places of interest randomly killing people and taking there stuff. Fun Fun :D

Risen is a game that puts the consequence of mans actions to the test. The gods were driven away by man in order to have thier own free will but in return, the old rulers of destruction and devestation returns to reclaim what was once theirs.

I would recommended buying this game when it is on sale.

7.5/10
amazing game, great gameplay, awesome landscape!!!

Gameplay is standard fare if you've played any of the Gothic games, but there's lots of things to do and lots of well written characters and quests... if not particularly well acted ones (some are good, most are alright and a few are bad, i don't think any are dire tho).

I'd recommend it.

Actually a pretty good little RPG. I enjoyed the action, though it was a little tough in the beginning. The story was enjoyable, though the characters could have been more in depth.  I enjoy more interaction with NPCs and a little more romance. The food and drink and smoking were fun, as was the alchemy, item creation, and goldsmithing. The ending was a little abrupt. I always prefer letting us back into the world to wrap anything up and have some denoument with the main characters. With the price and considering its age, overall 4 of 5.

This was a really great RPG that kept being interesting and challenging up till the end.
It's probably one of the toughest I've played, but the game kept giving you just the right amount of chances to continue, that it never felt unfair.
The game area, the island you are stranded on, has just the right size that you feel it's not tiresome to get from A to B, and later, a fast travel system is introduced too.
Good story, great side-quests and monsters that do not level with you equals a great game to me.
Grab it during a sale and enjoy 40-60 hours of solid RPG.

I don't know how I missed this one! Despite being one of THE BEST RPGs I've played in recent years, it still has that same old Deep Silver trademark bugginess. You'll have to restart often as the graphics engine will randomly crash, while everything else keeps going (conversations, HUD, music etc). But you know what?? It's worth it, I'm not saying that this is forgiveable by any means, beacause it isn't, but give it a chance at least. Who knows, maybe five years on, they'll patch it. Yeah, right.
Better than Gothic 2, and thats saying a lot!\nGreat story, choices, voice acting, quests.\nOne of the best RPGs I've played
Great game. Very enjoyable.

This Game is a masterpiece in my oppinion. The graphics and scenery are wonderful to look at, as much as the music is a joy to listen to. I found the Combat fun if not a little repetetive, and The Magic and Crafting system very well done to. One final thing thats fantastic about the game is the environment created. The island of Faranga" is a beautiful land that is one of my favorite places to venture in an rpg by far. I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys fantasy rpg's who's old enough for certain material in it. I give "Risen" a personel 10/10 and will always hold a place in my top 10 games."

Really tough to get started.... have to be hardcore RPG fan.... sadly I am and I really kinda like this game, fighting is hard, I mean you think you can just left click but some actions by mobs are so random its hard to counter.... Save alot and get ready for lots of frustration and dying... if you can get past that thought game is pretty ok... a 6/10

Nice RPG in the 3rd person. Rewards exploration, so do not be in a rush, look around your surroundings before moving on to the next area, it will help. Kinda old school, so if you are looking for the latest and greatest, you might not enjoy, but if you like the classics and taking your time planning your character, this might just be for you. the price sure won't break the bank either ;)

I have never finished this game nor I ever, most likely, will, but still I return to it time to time.\nI can give only one reason why I do it, because the world feels alive. because most NPCs have a routine and this game has much spoken text, if you chose to talk to NPCs. Not much for todays standards, but enough for me for a few hours time to time.

this is a brilliant game if you enjoy the kind of games where you start out with nothing and have to gather supplies in order to survive, just make sure if you decide to attack the friendly NPC's that they are definitely dead, because they can and will fight back and steal one or two of your items when they knock your character out. all in all this is a brilliant game and i recommend giving it a try if you enjoy this style of gameplay.

Risen is game that kind of takes the old accepted RPG formula, and goes FULL out on giving you that experience.
Everything in the game feels satisfying: from the large variety (and amount) of loot that you'll find, to the interaction with the
often quirky NPCs.
I definitely recommend Risen as a game to play. Personally, the 25 hours I've spent playing this game have been perfect,
no real speedbumps to my enjoyment.

There are a few bugs, which are easily fixed: If you cant see quests, change your resolution to a different one(aspect ratio) and change it back.

A decent game that caters to the likes of any RPG fan. You literally began the game in rags and work your way up to becoming a formidible warrior. It's a challenge at first as everything can either one-hit you or two-hit you. On the small chance that you're near a group of potential allies, you can lead anything attacking you towards them and they'll join in the battle, presuming you have your weapons sheathed, lest they try to kill you as well. With its extraordinary scenery, gripping storyline (which, though a mystery at first, is revealed in time), and engaging combat, Risen is well worth the purchase.

reviewText: I had no idea I would spend so long in this game.
This game is very fun and hard which adds to the fun of the game.

I enjoyed this game all the way through. From the developers of the Gothic series... which you can tell because it's pretty much like those games but modernized. The combat is improved, and the graphics are very much improved. For 2009 this game looks amazing (with the graphics turned all the way up). The game isn't perfect... there are some glitches, but they're mostly minor and don't affect gameplay much. A big chunk of this game is about exploring. Most of the game you're exploring a huge island, and later parts of the game you'll be in ruins and underground caves. Most of the enemies you kill stay dead, but at the beginning of a chapter some enemies do respawn. The combat is challenging, but satisfying. The story starts alittle dull, but by the end it's very interesting. If you're up for a challenging Action-RPG, and your computer can handle it, then I highly recommend Risen.
If you are looking for a great RPG in a more classic way, with no flashy kill cam moves"

reviewText:
Very enjoyable game IMO. Probably one of my favourite RPGS I've played to date. It's very old, so the graphics and such aren't up to par with the newer games, but the storyline and the gameplay more than make up for that. I found the storyline enjoyable to play, and I liked progressing through the game in my own manner. Most things you can do in this game are very fun, and easy to get a hold of.

Complaints include: There isn't any character customization at all, you're stuck with the same man as your character with the same look and same voice and there isn't much class customization either, you can use an axe, or a sword, or a bow, or go two-handed/dual wield. The mobs become considerably harder near the end of the game, as well, even with Titan-level weapons, and armor, the mobs prove to be very challenging, and annoying.

Overall, this game has a fairly old school feel to it and has a lot of fun RPG elements involved, making it one of the most enjoyable RPGS I've played to date. Worth the money, I think.

8.5/10

Let me begin by saying that this game will not start you off with any experience or skills. You need to be aware of that before you ever start playing. You start out shipwrecked on an island wearing only the ragged clothes on your back . This game comes about as close to a real life scenario as you can get.

If you got shipwrecked in real life with little to no combat experience or training it would be just like Risen. You have to find weapons, potions, food, and all the other stuff by exploring, learning to fight and getting experience killing various beasts and monsters.

I love the fact that as I get more skills, training, better weapons and experience, that the game gets better. I was getting frustrated with getting killed all the time, but I slowed down and took my time to build up my skills. Pigs and wolves used to eat me for dinner all the time. Now I can pretty much just smack them down and get on with my travels.

The game is really hard for the first ten hours or so, but it gets a lot better and easier if you stick with it. I have seen a lot of reviews talking about the horrible combat, but most people judged it on the early game play. You have to train and level up to get more attacks and better combat.

If you stick it out and train enough, you will get some very effective and proper attack and parry sequences to use. You also have to have enough strength or agilty to make the combat more effective and deadly. Like in real life, you don't just know how to sword fight and use weapons. You have to train and practice non-stop to get the skills and experience. There is a reason people have to practice martial arts for years before the can call them selves a master or to even be above the novice levels of skill.

When I first tried Risen right after it was released I hated it. I finally came back and tried it again and now I love it. It's not a perfect game, but it is a solid 8 out of 10 for me. There are some flaws, and some things annoy me, but so does real life. The length of time the game gives you: and the feeling of growing and getting better and progressing make it all the more enjoyable.

One of the only things I did not like was the lack of armor and clothes. You get a pretty fair amount of weapons, but the armor is pretty limited.  I can overlook that in light of the fact that in real life you would not have an endless array of new outfits to find. You get a lot of chances to get better weapons, both from enemy drops and vendors. Weapons are pretty satisfying, they fit with the game progression and leveling up.

After finally finishing my first play through, I can see why this game has such a dedicated following. It's called a cult" game on some forums
date: and I would have to agree. It's got a pretty good length
recommended: but not one where you get so bored with all the meaningless fedex fetch quests where you never finish it.\n\nI loved the Gothic games back in the day
hoursPlayed: and now Risen is on my list of extremely satisfying games. I am now going to do another play doing the whole bandit quest line. The game is that good that I want to fully experience every twist and turn from all the different progression/character lines.\n\nThe fact that you have multiple ways to approach all the quests
voteText: and very diverging paths and consequences make it something rare to find in today's modern RPGs.\n\nThe graphics are still pretty good
helpfulPercent: even though this game is five years old. The game world is amazing
votesHelpful: lots of gorgeous scenic views and natural locations. Ruins and cities are very nicely done
votesTotal: if a bit repetitive.\n\nIf you have patience and love to play a game where you learn and grow as you progress through it then I highly recommend it for true RPG fans."

reviewText:
A good spiritual successor to the Gothic games, which I don't play nearly as often as I'd like.

Combat is excellent, and like Gothic, your actual skill at it means more than anything they give you to improve it in the game.
You also get 3 combat paths in the main story, so you can play through its rather quick campaign multiple times without getting bored.

The only downsides to this game are the sparse character models, and that it's a little short, with no DLC.
An underrated gem.

I started PC gaming with no money in my pocket for games and old franken-pc. Luckily for my though I have an awesome brother that shared his game library with me so I would have games. Looking through his huge library I wanted to play a RPG, but lacking the graphics and processing power to play Skyrim I chose Risen over many better rated and more popular games. I went into Risen with a open mind and a mindset locked on the idea of going on an adventure as I go through a whole new world filled with foriegn beasties and skilled warriors. This game delivered many great hours of entertainment through an intresting and well designed world to explore, and intriguing plot characters. I felt immersed in this world with all it's beautiful landscape and lore, and I found myself playing it over and over wantig to get further. I haven't played Risen in a few months, but I am looking forward to picking it back up one day and continuing my escapade on this island of wonder and amazement. I highly recommend picking it up if you haven't played many RPGs and want to get into them. This game got my ball rolling to want to play more RPGs and I'm glad I was able to play it. Just as a post script I did buy the game even though I could play it for free from my brother's account because it had given me solid hours of play and was worth supporting the developers.
Awesome game. Very funny! :D

Risen offers a beautiful open world, great characters and dialogues and very long playtime what makes it a must have for RPG fans like me.\nThe poor jump/fall animations, fastload lag and some other bugs are the only reason for me to deduct a point, therefore my review score is 9/10.
Cool game. Especially for Gothic series fans like me.

If you like RPGs, this one's pretty darn good. If you have a 'puter with awesome specs, the graphics are nice as hell. Not as story-driven or complex as Dragon Age, but lots of exploration. Definitely recommend.

Having played 'Gothic' (1+2), I always perceived 'Risen' as a low-quality rip-off until I decided to give it a chance, and I have to say it exceeded my expectations.

Agreeable visuals, excellent performance, interesting characters (mediocre voice-overs, though). Better controls and interface compared to 'Gothic', combat is more fluid and controllable. Story and quests are acceptable, immersion and atmosphere work rather well - there is a casual, ironic feel to it, mostly due to the sassy, sarcastic hero character (whom you don't necessarily have to agree or sympathize with, I know I didn't most of the time).

Just like in 'Gothic', the pace is rather slow and the difficulty often demanding, you die easily and will have to reload a lot until you completely figure out how combat works and where not to go too soon (enemies do not scale to your character level).

That being said, you can mostly go anywhere at any time and choose the order in which to do things. I enjoyed this freedom and found the island an interesting place to explore, even later in the game.

Think of 'Risen' as a top-notch B-Movie which fully recognizes its limitations and, instead of overreaching itself, chooses to excel in this role.

I'm excited for 'Risen 2' and heartily recommend this one =)
Splendid RPG!
As close to the Gothic-Series as u can get. Believe me, this game is worth it's money. I LOVE IT!
Awesome game. Very funny! :D
A beautiful immersive old-school rpg with all the glory of gothic (1 and 2 obviously) . Totally worth the current price.

I had a lot of fun playing this game despite some flaws.

Positives:
- You basicallly start off with rags, and a stick but can end up a very OP character at the end if you work at it
- Beautiful open world environment
- Can tackle quests in multiple ways
- Lots of opportunities to make choices, and find multiple paths through the main quests, and smaller quests
- I actually liked how the leveling system worked, and how you increase your attributes even though it can get expensive
-  Learn various skills to keep you busy such as sword fighting, ax, magic, thievery, crafting skills


Negatives:
- can get a little glitchy ocassionally(sometimes looks like you are in a middle of an earthquake)
- No fast travel (at least not right away) so lots of backtracking at first
- Combat system is not that great at least not in early game. Need to master parrying, and side steps
- Wild life likes to stun lock you and proceed to combo you to death so be cautious

The negatives don't break the game or made me want to stop playing but keep those in mind.

Overall I  recommend to any RPG fan or someone looking for a nice adventure game where your choices matter.

I like this game very well. It has an unique atmoshphere and every fight ( specially in beginning of the game ) is a fight for life. I feel myself a real nobody without a good gear and this is much more realistic than other ones... Need tho thinking and re-thinking about our movements and what i like to learn, because it has weight... Every step in the game. Hard and sometimes fustrating a little bit, but after all i love it!

If you liked the Gothic Series, this Game will serve your RPG needs. It's simply another Gothic Game, just with a newer look, a new hero and a new Story. But the feeling is the same. It has a big Island to discover, two factions to side with and lots and lots of Quests. The thing I really like about Risen (and I liked about the Gothic Games) is the fact, that you have to start as a weak guy, that can't handle too many or too strong enemies, and that you have to earn a lot of experience to get stronger and better. Risen is a game for those who like an open and vibrant world to discover, and the challenges of many different quests.

Went back to playing this game after nearly 4 years. Its still good. And its still hardcore. I dont know, I couldn't explain it - but aside from its quirky, clunkiness, I still find the game so much more fulfilling in levelling up. Maybe because its hard? Maybe because its old school? You just get more and more attached to your character because you know you worked hard.  I dunno, for some reason I'm having a wee bit more fun playing this right now than...Skyrim maybe?

I really wanted to give this a chance because it was quite fun and the opening to the story sounded interesting..

However the combat system has ruined this game for me.
I've been gaming for years now, I love RPGs and have played games with similar combat systems, but this was pretty difficult!

It starts off fine, as you'd expect from any game, kill the noob creatures in a few hits to learn the basics.. Then by the time you're level 2 enemies need about 10 hits and only take about 3 to kill you - you better parry every hit!
It's not like you can even dodge heal and carry on since drinking a potion or eating takes a good couple of seconds.

I died about 3 times and got bored having to pay so much attention to every move the enemy took.

I don't know if there's something I'm missing, maybe once I get to train/learn skills? But for now I'm putting it away, maybe I'll go back some day.
Not bad; it has a high sense of difficulty though.
Great action RPG, not so long and not so hard, but still it has some smart puzzles and a few hours of fun.
Nice RPG easy to play worth a look for sure
Okay game to pass the time decent combat bit laggy at some points but otherwise a good buy.
Picked it up on a bundle...and decided to try it..was a really fun surprise..a tad old and very limited armor wise....but great story and fun game!
I couldn't get into Risen. There's very little guidance and the opening is painfully slow. Perhaps it eventually pays off, but next to no enjoyment in the first two hours is a no-go for me.
One of the best spelunking games in the past decade.  Too bad they ruined it with the sequel.

Very enjoyable game IMO. Probably one of my favourite RPGS I've played to date. It's very old, so the graphics and such aren't up to par with the newer games, but the storyline and the gameplay more than make up for that. I found the storyline enjoyable to play, and I liked progressing through the game in my own manner. Most things you can do in this game are very fun, and easy to get a hold of.

Complaints include: There isn't any character customization at all, you're stuck with the same man as your character with the same look and same voice and there isn't much class customization either, you can use an axe, or a sword, or a bow, or go two-handed/dual wield. The mobs become considerably harder near the end of the game, as well, even with Titan-level weapons, and armor, the mobs prove to be very challenging, and annoying.

Overall, this game has a fairly old school feel to it and has a lot of fun RPG elements involved, making it one of the most enjoyable RPGS I've played to date. Worth the money, I think.

Risen is a great rpg. It is very similar to Fable II with the control of the character and type of play.

You suffered shipwreck and stranded on an island. You see bodys of other shipwrecked persons. Are they alive? A woman is. Where are you and are there other people on this island? You need to explore this island. You'll walk through the dangerous forest up hills and eventually find a recourse, but this is only the beginning. You will find a whole island to explore with different factions and with choices to be made.\n\nThis game is alot like Gothic, because it is from the same developer. It doesn't quite reach the Level of Gothic 1 or 2, but it's still very good. Only the end gets a bit repetitive as you have to visit several temples.

A solid RPG loaded with mystery and adventure. The combat seems clunky and difficult at first, but if you stick with it, you'll eventually see what a beautiful system it really is. There's a few minor technical issues but nothing major. Overall a really great game.

The this I like best about this game is the calm and relaxed atmosphere. This makes it a real enjoyment to play. I have played through it around 3-5 times, and I still feel that I could play more without getting bored.

The combat system might be a bit difficult to master. In order to be real good you'll need precise timing of your attacks. The weapon classes are very different. I must say that it's much harder to go with staff fighting than using an axe.

I can't remember encountering any gamebreaking bugs. Only one I can think of, but I would look at it as more of a glitch than a bug.

Wow, good game. The combat actually requires skill to play and isnt all based on your characters attributes. This game has a good open world feeling to it with lots of side quests.. i only just started chapter 2 and ive been playing 25 hours. So far I am pleasantly surprised.
A difficult, strange but overall good game, very Gothic like.

From the creators of Gothic1, 2, and 3 before they split from their parent company, Risen is an old school RPG that doesn't hold your hand. By this I mean it doesn't give you quest markers, obvious clues or save you from impending doom. What it does offer is a vast island to explore with an epic story driven by magic and mystery. If you are a fan of the Pre-Gothic4 Gothic series I advise you to pick this game up. It's all that Gothic3 should have been on release; polished, fun and enormous. Just a warning: The first half of the game is an overworld exploration and the second half is mostly dungeon crawling.

If you liked the Gothic series, you will like this game as well. Its literally the same concept. There are a ton of good stuff to say about this game, I liked that they werent affraid to use vulgar words, it always knocks me off a bit when people talk sophisticated in sewers and places full of rats and dirt and everything. The battle system is like the afore mentioned series, you never feel like you are a god, there are plenty of creatures that will kick your rear end for a long while until you get better skills, equipment. I quite liked the fact that every monster has a weakness, a pattern of how they fight which you can exploit if you pay attention, however in some cases it's still hard to figure out what's your opponent going to do.

The only thing I didn't like was the lack of models for NPCs, it's kind of disappointing when you see the same faces in every town. Story is kind of meh, its not bad, but its nothing extraordinary either, average at best.

Overall I'd highly recommend this game, great spells, great system, lots of choices to go with, classic Gothic/Piranha Bytes game.

9/10
Dated graphics and combat system, plot and ambience is pretty decent. I guess it's a hit or miss when it comes to personal tastes on this title. Got it included in the Deep Silver humble bundle.

An excellent RPG with a rewarding skill-based combat system, a beautiful hand-crafted open world, and interesting factions. The factions provide for a bit of a replay value, since your missions change a bit depending on who you join. The first few chapters of the game are excellent and dialogue-heavy, but the last couple of chapters devolve into hack'n'slash.
8/10 - The only Gothic 3. Could have been longer and with respawning enemies.
Great RPG - hard as balls until the combat mechanics click for you. I recommend you read up on how to time sword swings as a first step and never forget: RESPECT THE PIG.

From what appears to be a simple RPG at the outset to a game with hidden depth and maturity as you progress. Combat seems like many other hack and slash games but overlies interactions with characters, puzzle quests and a storyline which keeps the pace of the game up and brings ouy up to side quests etc. An easy going RPG with a great deal more depth and reward than is initially apparent.

If you like RPGs and Gothic 1/2, then you must play this. It's Gothic 1's story combined with gameplay of Gothic 2. Memorable characters on a huge detailed island with no loading (I'm looking at you Skyrim). The only negative about this game is the combat that takes some time to get used to. It's like Dark Souls minus the rolling around.

A great RPG for fans of the Gothic series. Don't come into this one expecting a fleshed-out combat system.  The character interactions as well as general questing are fantastic and will keep you occupied for hours at a time.
Gothic 4 is not Gothic 4, this is Gothic 4. Even though it says it is Risen, it isn't. It's Gothic 4. And it's great.

Being first and foremost an RPG fan myself, I can't possibly praise this game enough. This is widely considered among the most loyal of Pirahna Bytes (Pirahna Bytes is the name of the development team) fans to be the 'unofficial Gothic 4.' This game easily inspires the imagination creating a wonderous and fantastic RPG experience. It may not be continuation of the Gothic storyline, but to any Gothic fan, the general feeling of euphoria born from this gaming exerperience is almost indistinguishible from that which was felt in Gothics 1, 2 and 3. Don't let the 77/100 rating be misleading. I would easily give this game a 90/100. As this is merely a matter of opinion, though, I would recommend trying the demo first. Just note that the demo can't begin to capture the depth and variety of the full game.

I recommend this game to all Gothic fans, and fans of RPG in general. AS with Gothic, you are teh nameless hero caught up in the middle of a war between humans and Titans, who were once baneshed by the Gods. On the way you are able to join one of the factions and save Faranga from total destruction.

Be a hunter for the Don, Warrior of the Order or become one of the mages in your quest to save the island.

The atmosphere is great and music gives you the feeling of belonging in that world.
Didn't expect much.  Loved it.
Loved the game.
Awesome RPG, like Gothic 1&2\n\nRating: A
Not the greatest of the RPG ever made, but for someone who likes the classic Gothic games this is a must play.

I'm a huge fan of the Gothic series, and this game is really a reboot of the series. It has the same art style, hand-built world and quest system you're used to.

It's definitely dated, but there is something under the covers of this series that just draws you in more than it's action-oriented siblings.

When each and every encounter in the game can be lethal but at the same time you can be a plate-wearing, magic casting bad-♥♥♥♥, it's all worth it.

There are no classes, just skills. You basically build your character exactly how you want to and play the game as such,

Choices do matter, and the income is not always readily apparent, saving often is wisely recommended.

Would totally drink the Order kool-aid again.

reviewText: Graphics seem somewhat dated for a 2009  game but on the whole a very highly addictive rpg. A decent storyline and very fun to follow. This gamew has me playing till all hours of the night.

It's like Gothic only nicer. Oh and the controls are easier.

Risen is an open world fantasy adventure game in which you'll be fighting monsters, solving quests and being a general nuisance to the wildlife.
Risen is an action rpg so combat will take a bit of practice but as you level up timing of your combos and block becomes easier. Like in Gothic you can join one of three factions that determine your main playstyle. Similar you can explore much of the island from the start and be promptly eaten by wolves.

Risen is like a good book, it takes you away to a magical world and lets you explore it and find it's secrets. It takes just the right amount of time to finish it too, it's not done in a day but not so long so you feel like it'd take years to complete.

Dad rating: fine
monsters and violence. Anything up to walking skeletons. Might be a bit scary for the little ones.
when you play it you enter a new world. It lets you escape like few games can.

Anyway

Have Fun !

Still, very enjoyable game and I'm going on to play Risen 2 & 3.

The combat system is based on your skill and it's complex, you need to dodge and learn when to strike.

Following in the footsteps of Gothic 1 and 2, Risen is just what you expect from an open world game, reasonably save paths, but stray to far from it and you get attacked (and in the beginning probably )killed by creatures ranging from undead to the local wildlife.\n\nIf you like Gothic 1 & 2 and maybe some aspects of Gothic 3 then you will love this game as well.

RISEN Review
I have to admit that ive been wrong about Risen in the past and i can say now that Risen is quite an underrated RPG. Its one of those games that growns on you the more you play it, sure can be frustrating at start and quite demanding but you need to have alot of patience and be smart. Risen its an RPG that doesnt hold your hand meaning theres no arrows above your head pointing the goals of the quests, the quest map points you in a general direction and you have to explore for yourself, yes it will take time but its rewarding when you actually find something. As you play this for the first time my advice its to go Inquisition and arm yourself with a Shield and 1h Sword at all times, i know the appeal for a 2h Broadsword or a staff is huge but you will die alot more and learn fire magic asap. Learn the combat tricks like driving your oponent against a wall or use an nearby NPC.

Graphics

Not last gen but arent near as bad that you have to gouge out your eyes out with spoons in fact at times they can be quite pleasant.

Sound and Music

Music is great and adds to your imersition into the game while the sound is an hit&miss kind of deal where some NPCs dialoges are quite well writen and performed, others drop your IQ everytime they open their mouths but overall is good.
If you endured starpoint gemini 1 dialogues you can endure anything.

Gameplay

Now heres the big elephant in the room and its the reason for most of the hate this game gets. The combat style in this game is NOT for everyone and requires a ton of practise, it's imperative that you have to learn and master your combat moves, spaming atacks will get you nothing but deaths and frustration. Block, roll will be your best friends aside from your shield and armor and get friends with your save&load buttons, you will use them alot. Use your head and tactics, fire an arrow or spell before meele atacks, use an NPC nearby for an extra sword, if the oponent kills you fast comeback later when youre stronger. Master all this and this game is quite rewarding.
The only game that doesn't even load in my steam library...

This game is awesome.
Why?
Well, let's start off by saying that this game takes back the old school RPG formula, that will entertain people that weren't born yet to experience the feeling or other people that just didn't like RPGs.
Second, it gives you a real sense of progression. At the start of the game anything can kill you in a few hits, your blows are weak and the weapon you have is weak. But then, depending on the path you choose, you can learn magic, improve your abilities and forge your own weapons and trinkets.
The story is not bad, the graphics are ok (REMEMBER TO ENABLE V-SYNC THROUGH NVIDIA CONTROL PANEL or in the amd one) and the variety in the environments is ok too.
So, is it worth playing? Hell yea, and when you are done you can could start again and choose a different path, basically changing the story entirely. I completed the game in around 40 hours the first run, now I will start the second playthrough as a Don lackey.
have fun!

This actually isn't a recommendation.

In fact it's a suggestion to stay the hell away from the game. It's DRM attempts to install drivers into your system.  If anyone values their system they wouldn't intentionally do this.

I'm glad I only wasted the $5 on it during the steam sale rather than actually paying full price.  I'd suggest if you did get it, consider cracking it to bypass the stupid DRM.

From the creators of Gothic1, 2, and 3 before they split from their parent company, Risen is an old school RPG that doesn't hold your hand. By this I mean it doesn't give you quest markers, obvious clues or save you from impending doom. What it does offer is a vast island to explore with an epic story driven by magic and mystery. If you are a fan of the Pre-Gothic4 Gothic series I advise you to pick this game up. It's all that Gothic3 should have been on release; polished, fun and enormous. Just a warning: The first half of the game is an overworld exploration and the second half is mostly dungeon crawling.

(7/10)
*Buy while on sale!

reviewText: The best gothic rpg game out there. The Combat system is addictive when you get use to it.

OK, 1st things 1st\nTHIS IS NOT A GAME FOR A CASUAL GAMER!! Casual gamers will likely die every 30 minutes. Also note it is quite very possible, particulary against certain creatures, that a low level creature will kill a high level player. This game requires a degree of strategy. This is not the kind of rpg where you can just order your attacks to happen 3 moves away from now. Combat is brutal! But, despite all I have said, for those who are willing, this game delivers a rewarding experience. Also, very important to note, at least through out my playthrough, the jump to ledge" worked very little. I would be forced to press ctrl+alt+delete and bring up task manager and start up the game again. As frustrating as this is there is away around it (however
date: depending which of the 3 career paths you go down it can get quite expensive). Despite the very difficult combat and the jumping up to ledge issue
hoursPlayed: the 60 hours was just for 1 play through"

reviewText:
so, i have mixed feelings about this game, when i bought it i bought as part of a bundle with risen 2 and 3 for something like £6, so £2 a game is a pretty good deal. first things first i did not expect the game to contain as much as it does, Alchmey, mining, smithing, gold smith, Magic, runes, Scrolls and a pretty big world to explore. there is litrally loads you can do with your character.
Combat is where the game lacks :( which is unfortunate to be honest, depending on your wepon of choice depends on how you defeat enemies, early game you wont worry about damage as most monsters will be under your level and will fall realitivly easily but later on around lvl15 when you start getting lizardmen turning up and direwolves it gets very hard because they can smash you into pulp in 1 or 2 hits.
Another thing to bear in mind is the Leveling up system, to begin with you will level up fairly quickly and when you lvl up you get 10 action points which can be used to advance a skill whether it be Sword fighting, Axe Fighting, Staff Fighting, this is very important as if you waste points in areas of your character your not going to use, then late game is going to be near impossible for you.

All in all, i'm impressed how good the game is for the age of the game and the amount of things you can do, Ohh and one last thing, The Voice acting is pretty bad... But it works very well with the feel of the game.

Dan
Bsc Games Design

reviewText:
A challenging Skyrim lite adventure, with combat system requiring more competence than in Witcher 3 and voice acting bordering on uncanny enough to enjoy the experience rather than going through motions.

Upon crashing on island you find yourself fixing everyone's problems, from orcs being too overly rowdy with bashing the skulls in on the roads, to decade long daddy issues of newly met characters. From rags to riches, you start hitting overfed mosquitos with a stick, advance yourself through ranks as a trustee of 2 different factions( one in two denominations ) to find yourself hitting more fantasy lore revered monsters with a stick that has a pointy metal edge on top.
You get to traverse the maze of unmarked investigations, one thing already dead within the real of video game convenience as well speech checks, that if taken too far can land you with floor sweeping job, or without your head. Ah the possibilities.

The cons :

The game however, can be a bit too formulaic in gatekeeping certain content, directly tied in your equipment upgrades through main mission. The crafting is pretty basic and the advantages of advancing certain skill paths pretty unclear, especially that you will find yourself short on training points and gold most of game. Even if alot of quests leave you to your own devices in figuring out the solution, often they aren't as intuitive as they could. Resorting to a guide, if not often, isn't anything unusual when it comes to Risen. I mean, there are a lot of games to play.

Overall if you know and enjoy games like Gothic 1 and 2, this game will click with you. If you like map markers and a combat where your character sommersaults from opponent to opponent with minimal effort on your side, it won't be a worthy purchase. If you like Witcher games, this might be a 50/50 roll.
One hour in, seems like a great game.  Oblivion mixed with Fable.  Somewhat linear gameplay so far but hopefully that will change some.  Also, for the price, you just can't beat the deal!

I bought this game on sale and am glad I did. I then played through it out of obligation. The game has no balance. On the standard normal mode combat is next to impossible and you will find yourself saving after every battle just so you don't have to redo it WHEN you die. Difficult combat would not be a bad thing, except its the driving force behind the game, almost everyquest has some sort of combat in it. I could continue to rant on the broken combat system talking about how counters require inhuman timing or how every enemy is able to attack faster then you, or how controls don't respond and you find yourself stuck in a six attack combo when you wanted to block, but I feel like you get the point.
Other aspects of the game such as the map and quest log are there but simple don't work 100% of the time (I've gotten them to work maybe twice).
Fear not there are some positives. First the game doesn't not look like complete garbage, no character customization, but the overall look of the game is moderatley appealing. Remember how I mentioned saving after every battle, well you can save anywhere, anytime (Even in the middle of a really annoying boss fight). The story is fairly intersting and about the only thing that has kept my interest in the game. For those who want a mental challenge many quests have a puzzle aspect to them.

Overall the game would be fine if it didn't rely so heavily on a broken combat system.

Side note: There is an entire main quest dedicated to becoming a pot dealer (best drug dealing simulator NA)

This game look good from the screen shots and most of the intro game play was pretty nice. However, now that I'm actually into the game I'm finding that I'm seriously regretting this decision. It would be nice if the quests weren't vague as hell and if the map actually showed you the region where you need to go so I'm not wandering in the swamp getting killed every time I turn around by a creature that can one-shot me. That's another thing. It would be nice if I you found armor or were given armor, or could buy armor. This way I wouldn't get killed by everything. This is important since every starting quest you get involved having to beat up armored bandits to get them to do their jobs and/or wandering into the monster infested swamp. Glad I only spent a couple of dollars on this.
If you love Oblivion you'll love this. I guess?

Risen is one of my favorite open world RPG's that I have ever played. This is my first review.

Pros:
1. The Storyline is interesting
2. Many Characters are fun and you end up caring for them
3, The Combat is brilliant
4. The Enviroment is well crafted and meticulous.
5. Great Leveling system with brilliant idea of having the player ear learning points that they can use for training
6. The crafting is rewarding after working hard to receive the materials and the schematics
7. Quests are clever and exciting
9. The dialogue is well worded, thee are plenty of options, and the voice acting is tremendous
10. AI is generally good.
11. The Atmosphere feels just right for a medieval tropical setting
12. The enemies look awesome and killing gnoos" (gnomes) is both fun and funny
13. There is plenty of content if you look for it
Cons:

1. The visuals appear somewhat dated (similar to Oblivion)
2. The map is a bit on the small side
3. The animations for the characters' faces do not line up with what they are saying most of the time
4. Not as many choices as there could have been
5. I personally believe that the game discourages exploration.
6. For some people a con would be that the enemies don't respawn until some major event takes place.
7. Vey buggy. DO NOT CLIMB ON OBJECTS WHILE INSIDE

Overall the game is all that an RPG should be and more. It's an incredibly entertaining and rewarding game with great gameplay and combat mechanics. You will find that if you are a completionist
date: there is plenty of content. Play it twice (once a thief and once a member of The Order) if you want to expirience all that Risen has to offer. It is definitely worth purchasing if you are a fan of RPGs.\n\nHonestly

reviewText:
To anyone who has played the first 2 Gothic games and liked them: This is the closest we will get to a successor for that specific type of game we crave.

To anyone else:

This is a action-RPG with a few differences that IMO make it worth the price to play it:

1. Both Enemies and resources/consumables are finite meaning that there is no ''absurd grinding just to take one big baddie'', but at the same time the difficulty of the quests and monster placements have a nice curve to them so that you will most likely clear them in roughly the same order anyway. It's just that knowing that there's a natural end in sight aka: ''there's nothing left to kill'' makes the experience feel like your presence matters more in the world.

2. While the first point isn't all that unique having that in a Open-World does give it more of a niche that other bigger titles like the TES's don't have.

3. Item placements ( such as in chests or just laying around ) are static so after finishing it once ( or looking it up ) you can get a rough idea of where this and that weapon/consumables are, but while other may see this as ''lacking in replay value'' I see it as ''Nice gonna try to beat that tougher opponent to get a head-start next time'' since this again plays with the good difficulty they have. Also a lot of the good weapons have a pretty high stat requirement so you can't just go straight to one of the top weapons in game and use it immediately.

And now some cons:

1. The story tries to follow from the ending of Gothic 3 ( the neutral ending btw ) but at the same time try to be a new ''Original IP'' since they didn't have the license anymore after the 3rd game which might make fans of the Gothic games feel a uncanny valley effect throughout this game.

2. The story itself is also IMO kinda lackluster, which is a shame but then again the preceding games mentioned above while having IMO a few better characters were sorta the same in overall quality so if you're searching for deep and engaging characters/story then you might want to look elsewhere. ( Although while not deep this and it's predecessors do have probably the most down-to-earth or normalish feeling cast ever IMHO)
One hour in, seems like a great game.  Oblivion mixed with Fable.  Somewhat linear gameplay so far but hopefully that will change some.  Also, for the price, you just can't beat the deal!

A challenging Skyrim lite adventure, with combat system requiring more competence than in Witcher 3 and voice acting bordering on uncanny enough to enjoy the experience rather than going through motions.

Upon crashing on island you find yourself fixing everyone's problems, from orcs being too overly rowdy with bashing the skulls in on the roads, to decade long daddy issues of newly met characters. From rags to riches, you start hitting overfed mosquitos with a stick, advance yourself through ranks as a trustee of 2 different factions( one in two denominations ) to find yourself hitting more fantasy lore revered monsters with a stick that has a pointy metal edge on top.
You get to traverse the maze of unmarked investigations, one thing already dead within the real of video game convenience as well speech checks, that if taken too far can land you with floor sweeping job, or without your head. Ah the possibilities.

The cons :

The game however, can be a bit too formulaic in gatekeeping certain content, directly tied in your equipment upgrades through main mission. The crafting is pretty basic and the advantages of advancing certain skill paths pretty unclear, especially that you will find yourself short on training points and gold most of game. Even if alot of quests leave you to your own devices in figuring out the solution, often they aren't as intuitive as they could. Resorting to a guide, if not often, isn't anything unusual when it comes to Risen. I mean, there are a lot of games to play.

Overall if you know and enjoy games like Gothic 1 and 2, this game will click with you. If you like map markers and a combat where your character sommersaults from opponent to opponent with minimal effort on your side, it won't be a worthy purchase. If you like Witcher games, this might be a 50/50 roll.

This game look good from the screen shots and most of the intro game play was pretty nice. However, now that I'm actually into the game I'm finding that I'm seriously regretting this decision. It would be nice if the quests weren't vague as hell and if the map actually showed you the region where you need to go so I'm not wandering in the swamp getting killed every time I turn around by a creature that can one-shot me. That's another thing. It would be nice if I you found armor or were given armor, or could buy armor. This way I wouldn't get killed by everything. This is important since every starting quest you get involved having to beat up armored bandits to get them to do their jobs and/or wandering into the monster infested swamp. Glad I only spent a couple of dollars on this.

I bought this game on sale and am glad I did. I then played through it out of obligation. The game has no balance. On the standard normal mode combat is next to impossible and you will find yourself saving after every battle just so you don't have to redo it WHEN you die. Difficult combat would not be a bad thing, except its the driving force behind the game, almost everyquest has some sort of combat in it. I could continue to rant on the broken combat system talking about how counters require inhuman timing or how every enemy is able to attack faster then you, or how controls don't respond and you find yourself stuck in a six attack combo when you wanted to block, but I feel like you get the point.
Other aspects of the game such as the map and quest log are there but simple don't work 100% of the time (I've gotten them to work maybe twice).
Fear not there are some positives. First the game doesn't not look like complete garbage, no character customization, but the overall look of the game is moderatley appealing. Remember how I mentioned saving after every battle, well you can save anywhere, anytime (Even in the middle of a really annoying boss fight). The story is fairly intersting and about the only thing that has kept my interest in the game. For those who want a mental challenge many quests have a puzzle aspect to them.

Overall the game would be fine if it didn't rely so heavily on a broken combat system.

Side note: There is an entire main quest dedicated to becoming a pot dealer (best drug dealing simulator NA)

reviewText: A fairly decent adventure game with open world. The difficulty curve is fairly tough at the beginning as the world doesn't scale much. So you struggle at the beginning but it gets easier as your character gets stronger (be prepared to save and load a LOT).  It is fun though, and has interesting plot. Although you can build your character however you like to a degree
date: plot directly prevents you from doing some skill combinations. (For example, some skills can only be taught by some people who are enemies of other people who teach other skills). As a result, sides you choose will significantly impact your play style. (Some things you can work around a bit, others not so much). As such, the world, although fairly open, feels like a world with it's own limitations... not arbitrary limitations, but the world feels solid. I suggest playing it.

You crash land on an island.


You basically have 3 paths to choose from: Become a pirate, become a wizard, or become a slave.

I played for 30 hours only to realize I messed up and couldn't become a wizard. That being said, the game is pretty fun. I have stolen pretty much everything from everyone on the island.
Bester Teil der Serie.\nWirklich gutes RPG.

Setting (somewhat typical): You are a castaway. You wake up on an island loaded with evil temples and mutant animals, where everyone is addicted to drugs and alcohol, AIDS is rampant, and the vast majority of people speak in an English accent while cursing their faces off.

Pros:
- Great combat system
- Good map structure
- Intriguing quests

Cons:
- Animations are sub-par
- Immersion-ruining and rather excessive adult content (cursing, drugs and alcohol)
- Mega-load of sexual content
- No tutorial
- Savescumming should be expected every step along the way

I admit that cursing can add to the intensity of a situation provided it's done at the right time, but there is excessive swearing in this game to the point of being irritating. See that pirate guy in the jail? Be prepared for him to say the F-word three times within two sentences.
As with cursing, drugs and alcohol are displayed in excess. Practically everyone either smokes or drinks. Finally, was it really necessary to put a brothel in the game, let alone right in the middle of the starter town?

This really could have been a great game for me, but it was ruined by the buildup of these small annoyances.

Just finished it.

Positives:

- Good quality vs price: Well worth the money
- Mostly had fun playing through it.
- At one point the sword upgrade was broken (I had an item which boosted the sword by one and apparently there's a known bug for this) but there is an easy to access in game cheat system... which also greatly helps once you're bored with the game and just want to get through it (for me that was after about 32 hours)

Negatives:

- A little too long. It feels like they intentionally make you run around the world a lot to lengthen the game and at some point there are so many strong enemies that give you so much XP that you start wondering why you did all the small silly quests for 100 XP, when killing a single lizard gives you 320 xp.
- Quests malfunction sometimes and then become unclear.
- Not as polished as say SkyRim, sometimes quests aren't really clear. Little side quests do not show up all the time. Then again the level of polish it has is to be expected of an older game.
This game has the qualities of D&D and is really fun to play. Once you get hooked you'll play for hours.

reviewText: Very nice game, complex story, a lot of exploration and interaction.

so, i have mixed feelings about this game, when i bought it i bought as part of a bundle with risen 2 and 3 for something like £6, so £2 a game is a pretty good deal. first things first i did not expect the game to contain as much as it does, Alchmey, mining, smithing, gold smith, Magic, runes, Scrolls and a pretty big world to explore. there is litrally loads you can do with your character.
Combat is where the game lacks :( which is unfortunate to be honest, depending on your wepon of choice depends on how you defeat enemies, early game you wont worry about damage as most monsters will be under your level and will fall realitivly easily but later on around lvl15 when you start getting lizardmen turning up and direwolves it gets very hard because they can smash you into pulp in 1 or 2 hits.
Another thing to bear in mind is the Leveling up system, to begin with you will level up fairly quickly and when you lvl up you get 10 action points which can be used to advance a skill whether it be Sword fighting, Axe Fighting, Staff Fighting, this is very important as if you waste points in areas of your character your not going to use, then late game is going to be near impossible for you.

All in all, i'm impressed how good the game is for the age of the game and the amount of things you can do, Ohh and one last thing, The Voice acting is pretty bad... But it works very well with the feel of the game.

Dan
Bsc Games Design

if you see this on sale, then definetly get it. its a fun RPG with at least two 'paths' through the game.

I'm a huge fan of the Gothic series, and this game is really a reboot of the series. It has the same art style, hand-built world and quest system you're used to.

It's definitely dated, but there is something under the covers of this series that just draws you in more than it's action-oriented siblings.

When each and every encounter in the game can be lethal but at the same time you can be a plate-wearing, magic casting bad-♥♥♥♥, it's all worth it.

There are no classes, just skills. You basically build your character exactly how you want to and play the game as such,

Choices do matter, and the income is not always readily apparent, saving often is wisely recommended.

Would totally drink the Order kool-aid again.

reviewText: I needed a second try playing this, when I realised the charm of this game. The RPG elements are really nice here and the story seems fresh from the other games out there, at least well coupled with the gameplay features. It might be a bit hard to navigate the world at first, but then everything seems to fall in place after a while. I really liked the open world out there.\n\nI rate it 8 spells out of 10.

A very good RPG. Not very long and pretty varied in its gameplay. The story isn't particulary bright, but at least it exists. What shines is the wonderful island where the game takes place. It's not huge, but it's packed with things to do and mostly interesting characters.
The combat system may be frustrating at first, but becomes far more interesting as the game progresses. It's a bit repetitive, but you need to stay focused which helps break the feeling of doing always the same thing.

At the beginning of the game (first chapter on four), you mostly avoid enemies, rather focusing on dialogs and quests. I absolutely love this part though many players will be longing for some action.
During the second chapter, you really go around exploring every nook and cranny of the island. This may be the part I like the least because of the large number of savage animals you need to wipe out. It's a bit tedious sometimes. Then again, you're not required to completely clean the island. But I'm a bit of a completionist.
Chapters 3 and 4 are shorter and will let you explore bigger caves and dungeons. I also really liked this part though it feels like a completely different game than the first chapter. Ennemies are tough but less numerous. There are lots of traps and exploration and light puzzles to keep you occupied. I was afraid it would be more Diablo-like, but no. It's still a RPG.

reviewText: I first played this game almost 6 years ago when it came out. I recently bought it on Steam again just to give credit for its excellent producers. It really strikes me as how well it is designed and presented. The background music is absolutely great and story of the game is unpickable. Although the game is a small-scalled as compared to Skyrim and such, it is nonetheless as complicated as the big titles out there. What really stands out is the combact system. When you learn a skillpoint, you actually learn a new move, like parrying with your broadsord or staff instead of getting a damage boost. And it feels great to duel with melee weapons unlike some games where you fell like hit a sponge or something. This game is somewhat difficult to grasp at first. But it is much rewarding if you truly dwell into it.

great, fun game for fans of the genre

my time-played is approximately my single playthrough on hard difficulty. there's definitely a good solid adventure packed into this game, with lots of branching paths and clear, game-changing decisions to make.

it has an open world with a good sense of direction and purpose, as if it was all hand-crafted uniquely.

certain portions of the main quest are pretty dialog-heavy and its easy to skip past them. you may find yourself running around blindly clicking on everyone until all of your quests are done... but for those players who like the story-development, its fully and competently voice-acted.

its got the feel of gothic 1 or 2 but is very stable and prettier looking. i did not encounter any major bugs. solid game imo all around... if not a little slow paced at times.

A one of a kind RPG and a cult classic for me. Have played it more then 5 times in my life and have to say the first Risen game beats risen 2 and 3 by far. The combat is not for everyone since it's not your daily hack&slash game where they just stand still and let you get an easy kill.\nSo much to explore on the map even if it's not that big but there is always something new or treasure to dig up.\nAnd the enviroment is still good looking and the nights are really dark so torches are truely needed for exploring.

I give it 4.5/5 stars.  It would haven been 5 stars but the final boss fight became more tedious than fun.  The guy you fight just before the boss, now that was a fun fight!  I wish he was the ending instead.  So, I ending up youtubing the final boss and called it a day.

Still, very enjoyable game and I'm going on to play Risen 2 & 3.

I have been out on my gaming for awhile; I use to play a lot of games then felt burnt out and overall just bored with video games in general. Its been around a year of me not playing games besides the brief occasions of dabbling for a few hours for the nostalgia. I recently had an urge to get into a fun rpg, something open world that had a survival feel to it. though I was very limited on games I could get, because I sold all my consoles, and all I have is a 4 year old 300 dollar HP pavillion laptop. So with hours spend looking up reviews then checking if my laptop could run them I decided on risen. I AM SOOO GLADD I DID!!! My choices were down to gothic 3, two worlds 2 and risen. Which all of them have mixed reviews so it was hard to decide. So HERES MY REVIEW.  GRAPHICS - To me graphics really don't matter much if the game is really fun and this is the case here. keep in mind I play on all low for better performance but even at that I think the world is beautifully done. The weather and the lighting are awesome. When the sun is shining its really bright and actually looks like how bright it would be in real life. When its dark its as dark as it really would be in real life. its soo awesome looking when its dark out, your exploring, its storming and lightening and you get flashes of bright light where you see everything, it really looks badass. (now on high settings the graphics are really nice for its time.) so torches are actually a must if your going in really dark caves or traveling at the dark of night or you can wait to journey and sleep in a bed till morning.  I think it really immerses you in the world. GAMEPLAY- Now what I really really like about this game is the overall small details that a lot of games overlook, that really make the world feel alive IMO. For a RPG I think these details im about to explain are really important to a RPG because theirs people who play and really wanna get into the role of there character and the world hence ROLE playing game. First I'll start off with getting food and cooking it. in this game food really does matter idk how many times i was out exploring and if i didnt have food to boost my health I would of died. and you can find water barrels to drink from that will boost your health when your in need like being out of potions or only having a few. I like how when you cook food you see your character really cook the food, and when you drink you see your character really drink or when you eat whatever your eating he will actually take it out and eat it. when you kill someone in the game no matter who it is they will stay dead for the whole game, IT MAKES SENSE. when you go into someones home they will get mad and threaten you, it makes sense. when you want to up your stats in lets say pickpocking or swords you have to find someone who specializes in that art and pay them to train you, again it makes sense. The map isnt that big compared to like gta or skyrim but I think its pretty much perfect because there is a lot of content packed into it and it feels actually pretty damn big because you only run as fast as you do in like fallout 3 and new vegas. Plus in the beginning there is a lot of unknown places you cant explore because there are monsters their that are just to hard to kill untill you get stronger and better gear. So it gives you something to work for on the side. youll find a cave and get halfway through it then find there to be a monster that is just to strong, so you take note, leave, build up, gear up, get stronger, and go back later. The game has so much dialog and you can basically talk to anyone, your character actually speaks what you pick and he is such a smartass 98% of the time I love it. The story is not that special but I think its cool! its kind of like star wars with no force, instead magic, and theres the iquisition(which is like the empire) and then the bandits/dons men (which is like the rebels) your fighting for control of the island basically, you have the choice to choose what side you want to support. Now a lot of people dont like the combat and a lot love it, I love it even though it is basically 2 buttons, block and attack, what makes it really fun is you have to be really good with timing, its kind of like a timing mini game. if you attack at the wrong time you leave yourself open to get hit. Blocking is really important and swinging at the perfect time is also important, cause this game is really hard and if you dont play smart you will die tons. If you like games that hold your hand this isnt for you. But if you like games that really give you a challenge then it is for you. #noquestarrows. theres a lot more I can say about this game but it would go on too long. This game has became one of my all time favorite open world RPGs. It is underrated. Overall I give this game a hardcore 9.5/10

Risen is one of my favorite open world RPG's that I have ever played. This is my first review.

Pros:
1. The Storyline is interesting
2. Many Characters are fun and you end up caring for them
3, The Combat is brilliant
4. The Enviroment is well crafted and meticulous.
5. Great Leveling system with brilliant idea of having the player ear learning points that they can use for training
6. The crafting is rewarding after working hard to receive the materials and the schematics
7. Quests are clever and exciting
9. The dialogue is well worded, thee are plenty of options, and the voice acting is tremendous
10. AI is generally good.
11. The Atmosphere feels just right for a medieval tropical setting
12. The enemies look awesome and killing gnoos" (gnomes) is both fun and funny
13. There is plenty of content if you look for it
Cons:

1. The visuals appear somewhat dated (similar to Oblivion)
2. The map is a bit on the small side
3. The animations for the characters' faces do not line up with what they are saying most of the time
4. Not as many choices as there could have been
5. I personally believe that the game discourages exploration.
6. For some people a con would be that the enemies don't respawn until some major event takes place.
7. Vey buggy. DO NOT CLIMB ON OBJECTS WHILE INSIDE

Overall the game is all that an RPG should be and more. It's an incredibly entertaining and rewarding game with great gameplay and combat mechanics. You will find that if you are a completionist
date: there is plenty of content. Play it twice (once a thief and once a member of The Order) if you want to expirience all that Risen has to offer. It is definitely worth purchasing if you are a fan of RPGs.\n\nHonestly

RISEN Review
I have to admit that ive been wrong about Risen in the past and i can say now that Risen is quite an underrated RPG. Its one of those games that growns on you the more you play it, sure can be frustrating at start and quite demanding but you need to have alot of patience and be smart. Risen its an RPG that doesnt hold your hand meaning theres no arrows above your head pointing the goals of the quests, the quest map points you in a general direction and you have to explore for yourself, yes it will take time but its rewarding when you actually find something. As you play this for the first time my advice its to go Inquisition and arm yourself with a Shield and 1h Sword at all times, i know the appeal for a 2h Broadsword or a staff is huge but you will die alot more and learn fire magic asap. Learn the combat tricks like driving your oponent against a wall or use an nearby NPC.

Graphics

Not last gen but arent near as bad that you have to gouge out your eyes out with spoons in fact at times they can be quite pleasant.

Sound and Music

Music is great and adds to your imersition into the game while the sound is an hit&miss kind of deal where some NPCs dialoges are quite well writen and performed, others drop your IQ everytime they open their mouths but overall is good.
If you endured starpoint gemini 1 dialogues you can endure anything.

Gameplay

Now heres the big elephant in the room and its the reason for most of the hate this game gets. The combat style in this game is NOT for everyone and requires a ton of practise, it's imperative that you have to learn and master your combat moves, spaming atacks will get you nothing but deaths and frustration. Block, roll will be your best friends aside from your shield and armor and get friends with your save&load buttons, you will use them alot. Use your head and tactics, fire an arrow or spell before meele atacks, use an NPC nearby for an extra sword, if the oponent kills you fast comeback later when youre stronger. Master all this and this game is quite rewarding.

This game is awesome.
Why?
Well, let's start off by saying that this game takes back the old school RPG formula, that will entertain people that weren't born yet to experience the feeling or other people that just didn't like RPGs.
Second, it gives you a real sense of progression. At the start of the game anything can kill you in a few hits, your blows are weak and the weapon you have is weak. But then, depending on the path you choose, you can learn magic, improve your abilities and forge your own weapons and trinkets.
The story is not bad, the graphics are ok (REMEMBER TO ENABLE V-SYNC THROUGH NVIDIA CONTROL PANEL or in the amd one) and the variety in the environments is ok too.
So, is it worth playing? Hell yea, and when you are done you can could start again and choose a different path, basically changing the story entirely. I completed the game in around 40 hours the first run, now I will start the second playthrough as a Don lackey.
have fun!

I thought the reason I found this game so dull was because it was dated, but then I looked up the release date of TES: Oblivion and found out it was made 3 years before Risen. The combat and animations are terrible and the map is boring to explore, which may be because the world feels like a few linear branching paths and the movement is clunky. The worst animation though is the jumping. The space bar basically makes your caracter bend his legs and glide for 2 seconds. Loading takes 30 seconds off my ssd, ehich for a game this old makes no sense. I want to say something good about the game butI can't, though maybe that's because I have not gotten that far into it. I have leveled up three times but can't seem to distribute any points. In fact I have no idea what leveling up does. Maybe I need to be far enough into the game to get a class. All I have been able to do is find trainers which will improve stats and skills for gold.\nKeep in mind I have played a good bit of morrowind so I know how to extract value from a game despite the combat controls. I have found this game to be nothing beyond functional.
